definitions.example: Why are you in such a big hurry?
There is no hurry on that paperwork.

definitions.definition: An incidence of a defensive player forcing the quarterback to act faster than the quarterback was prepared to, resulting in a failed offensive play.
A tremolando passage for violins, etc., accompanying an exciting situation.
Often with up, to speed up the rate of doing something.
definitions.example: If you don't hurry (up) you won't finish on time.

definitions.definition: To cause to be done quickly.
To hasten; to impel to greater speed; to urge on.
To impel to precipitate or thoughtless action; to urge to confused or irregular activity.
To put: to convey coal in the mine, e.g. from the working to the tramway.
